intro: Cupheanthus paniensis, commonly known as the Paniensis cuphea, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, often attracting pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has small, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
